intro: Dyschoriste mollis, commonly known as the soft dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Dyschoriste mollis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
